perturbation.original_text: This amendment to Section 2 (titled "Term"), Part B of the Co-Branding Agreement is made effective December 9, 1996 by and between PC Quote, Inc. (hereinafter referred to as "PCQ") and A.B. Watley, Inc. (hereinafter referred to as "ABW"), who are also the parties contracted in the aforementioned Co-Branding Agreement. This Amendment shall apply to said PCQ and ABW and all of their subsidiaries and related companies.
perturbation.changed_text: This amendment to Section 2 (titled "Term"), Part B of the Co-Branding Agreement is made effective December 9, 1996 by and between PC Quote, Inc. (hereinafter referred to as "PCQ") and A.B. Watley, Inc. (hereinafter referred to as "ABW"), who are also the parties contracted in the aforementioned Co-Branding Agreement. This Amendment shall apply to said PCQ and ABW. Subsidiaries and related companies may be included at the discretion of PCQ.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states the amendment applies to subsidiaries and related companies of both PCQ and ABW. The modified text introduces a contradiction by stating that subsidiaries and related companies may be included at the discretion of PCQ, creating uncertainty about whether the amendment automatically applies to ABW's subsidiaries and potentially leading to disputes.

However, any modifications made to the agreement after this date must also be acknowledged and signed by a member of the board of directors to be deemed valid.
perturbation.explanation: The added clause introduces a contradiction: while the agreement is signed by the Director and President of A.B. Watley and PC Quote, it states that any future modifications require acknowledgement of a board member to be deemed valid. The original signed agreement may not meet this new requirement, creating uncertainty about the agreementâ€™s validity and further modification validity.
